A secular state ensures that such extremists are kept in check by the law.
 
 "God's law is above any human law. So when a human law ... is contrary to God's law, this human law has no value,"

post_info.post_title: Thank reason for separation of church and state.

I think the opposite is true, a state church will necessarily end up moderate. The ability to exclude people allows far more extremism when churches completely unfettered. Compare Christianity in the UK and the US.
